intro: Dischidia neurophylla, commonly known as the climbing fig or the ivy fig, is a tropical epiphytic plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Moraceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Its unique ability to climb and form dense mats makes it well adapted to growing on trees and rocky surfaces. Dischidia neurophylla is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ease of care.
